title.narrative: INTEGRATED POLICIES FOR Early Child Development (ECD)

description.narrative: Families, communities, civil society, private sector and governments has adopted comprehensive actions and integrated policies to promote Early Childhood Development, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 boys and girls have increased access to quality and responsive health, education and social protection programmes, and actively participate in the design, implementation and monitoring of these services.

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL
FUNDACAO PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO CIENTIFICO E TECNOLOGICO EM SAUDE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Families, communities, civil society, private sector and governments has adopted comprehensive actions and integrated policies topromote Early Childhood Development

description.narrative: BCO advanced on building an integrated ECD Strategy, positioning early childhood development as a key strategic cross-sectoral thematic, by articulating actions in different programmatic areas (Health, Education, Child Protection and Social Policy) and supporting municipalities and the legislative to prioritize ECD in local and national agendas. The Early Childhood Friendly Units initiative promotes intersectoral services of excellence for children in health and early education units, implemented in 6 capitals and 514 units. Also, UNICEF supported the strengthening of home visiting programmes through the qualification of professionals on caregiver’s mental health and wellbeing, the work with migrants, and with adolescent parents. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
